title: Add header navigation links to Events and Live Guestbook (already implemented)

requirements.text: Add primary navigation links in the top header (AppShell) for onboarded, authenticated users, including direct links to the existing Events and Community Guestbook pages.

quotes:
il faut ajouter la fonction creation d'évènement et le live guestbook.
Si c'est déjà le cas : ajoutes les liens en headers

acceptanceCriteria: When a user is authenticated and has completed onboarding, the top header displays navigation links that include at least: “Events” (route: /events) and “Chat” (Community Guestbook; route: /chat).
The header navigation uses English labels and is visually consistent with the existing navigation styling (active vs inactive state).
When the user is not authenticated and/or not onboarded, these community navigation links do not appear in the header (current access rules remain unchanged).

requirements.text: Ensure header navigation remains responsive: on small screens, keep the existing bottom navigation behavior; on larger screens, header links should be visible without removing the existing desktop navigation unless it is intentionally replaced by the header links.

quotes: Si c'est déjà le cas : ajoutes les liens en headers

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile (sm and below), users can still navigate via the existing bottom navigation.
On desktop/tablet (sm and above), the header shows the added navigation links and they correctly route to existing pages.
No routes are changed; existing pages (/chat, /events, /community, /leaderboard, /partners, /profile, /admin) continue to work as before.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components are read-only).
Do not edit any immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor (no architectural changes).
nonGoals: Do not re-implement events creation or the live guestbook/chat features; they already exist.
Do not add new backend methods or change backend data schemas for this request.
Do not add new pages or change route paths; only navigation discoverability in the header is in scope.
